title: (x) Hindi-like "Tribal Monsoon" - Samarkan (Shalimar) {Shreyas.R.Krishnan, (Mike F)}
content:
have seen this font used everywhere when they wanted to give it a slightly indian look...but i have no idea which font this is...or is it something doctored...any help would be appreciated...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100108184701im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_5351.gif)
author: Merryn

comments.content: I’ve forgotten that one, but there is also [Simran](http://web.archive.org/web/20100108184701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_simran/), [Modakshar](http://web.archive.org/web/20100108184701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/modakshar_ot/) and [Sansara](http://web.archive.org/web/20100108184701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/sansara/).

try samarkand.  
(im sure its on one of the comps in the IT)  
shreyas
Can you provide a link, Shreyas? I need visual confirmation before I can credit the identification.

Originally (predigitally) called Shalimar - and digitized by Type Revivals as [Shalimar](http://web.archive.org/web/20100108184701/http:/www.roostertypes.com/prod_display_single.asp?catalog_id=19879). Shreyas’s Samarkand is just as legitimate a revival, though. I’ve no idea about the relative quality of the two fonts.

Nice ID, Shreyas.
Yeah, what took you so long!? :^D
